top_categories.workout_context: 373 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Nordic Chase Gravel Edition's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Nordic Chase Gravel Edition's Scandinavian gravel (70%), Paved roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 373 miles.
At Nordic Chase Gravel Edition, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
26,247ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
70ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
26,247ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
373 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 26,247ft of climbing on scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal does to your power file on race day.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 373 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Nordic Chase Gravel Edition. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Nordic Chase Gravel Edition, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 373 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 373 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Nordic Chase Gravel Edition requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections to build confidence. Expect: scandinavian gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), rolling countryside.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 373 miles of scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections in Copenhagen, Denmark to Oslo, Norway.
